intro: Horkelia sericata, commonly known as silverleaf horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which gives it its common name. The plant produces small, blue to violet flowers that bloom in the spring. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Horkelia sericata is often found in open meadows and along mountain slopes.
